page.title: 05Winterbourne Stoke Church
page.content:
The church is dedicated to{St.Peter. In 1331 it belonged to the Priory of Hayling. It appears in the Domesday book saying that by order of William the Conqueror in 1086 the Abbot of Jumieges held this church.
There is a list of Vicars in the church since 1331. The building is of flint and rubble.It has two Norman doorways. The North one is ornate while the South doorway is more simply decorated and has been blocked up. On the Nave wall there is a holder for the hourglass to prevent sermons going on too long!
The{Font}has a cover of good style Jacobean carvings and at its foot are medieval tiles. The{Pulpit}is beautifully carved Jacobean.
